name: Contraption Maker
description: The team that created the original Incredible Machine® is bringing all of the Rube Goldberg craziness to the modern age. Solve puzzles involving ridiculous chain reactions full of hamster motors, trampolines, alligators, cats, and so much more.
minimum_requirements: Минимальные: ОС: Windows Vista Процессор: 1.7Ghz or Higher Оперативная память: 2 GB ОЗУ Видеокарта: 512MB VRAM, Pixel Shader 2.0 or higher DirectX: Версии 9.0c Место на диске: 300 MB

reviews.review_text: Very Interesting game. You are able to feed a cat by dropping a ball to turn on the electric cat feeder and then publish it directly through youtube on your gaming channel.  I said I would never write another game 'review', but the option to publish your recorded game directly to Youtube or download it and edit for Youtube is great. There is also an extra copy to gift to a friend ( 2 copies 1 price ) I am sure I will be playing this offline on my laptop when I am away and cannot acess the internet.

When I was a kid, I loved that old predecessor of this game. So I decided to pick it as soon as it is on a sale (basically because I doubted the quality of the game. The mechanics are old and trusted but still... I was affraid to see a soulless clone). Happily, this one brought me a crazy level of excitement and (even!) laughings!  The game is awesome and catchy. Once I laucnhed it to test for a while, I realised I have played like 80 minutes or something. And Contraption Maker didn't bore me at all. The missions are set in a very clever way, so each one is a bit harder then the previous, but not too much. You actually learn to play it step by step.  The puzzles are interesting and (the main thing!) really really different. I guess their puzzle designer is a nice guy with a good sense of humor. Besided, every puzzle has some kind of a plot, so you even start to sympathyse some characters (My fav is Waldo, what a gorgeous cat!). The game is simple and exciting, it is very light and kind, reminds me the most childish looney tunes cartoons. The music is awesome, and the controls are very intuitive. The only thing I noticed is a small little difference between designs of some elements and characters, but that's not a problem at all, just noticed. I've picked it for 0.99 on a sale and even recieved an extra copy to give some of my friends. I believe it would be an awesome present. Hardly recommended. If you are lucky to see it on a huge sale, take it without any doubt. I am not a fan of puzzle games, but this one is awesome even for people like me.
'The Incredible Machine rethought'

This one gave me a real nostalgia rush. I played the original 'Incredible Machine' as a kid, and boy, this was 1992 ! This awesome remake has everything the original had and a lot more. No fuzz, just really good puzzles. Some unagitated humor. And as the best part: Steam Workshop Support for an unlimited fresh supply of puzzles (although the offical ones will steal you hours of your life). Lovin' it!
The best Rube Goldberg machine based puzzle game money can buy. If you like Rube Goldberg machines, or just puzzles in general, do yourself a favor and pick it up!

I've never played The Incredible Machine, so no throwback memories for me on this one. The puzzles are very fun and creative. Although, the 'Hard' puzzles go from a good challenge that's really fun to staring at the screen, placing random objects, and hoping for the best. I would say that these last puzzles aren't family friendly because you'll probably swear a lot.  Once you finish the main puzzle sets, there's always the workshop puzzles, or you can make your own puzzles and/or contraptions, which means limitless gameplay.  It would be nice if there was an option to return to where you left off rather than having to scroll through to find your first unfinished puzzle.
Yes, this is The Incredible Toon Machine 2.0. Get it now.

This game is absolutely awesome. So much has been added since the game was first made. Recently 50 extra puzzles were added, as well as new parts for the community to create new puzzles. This is one of the few games that continues to improve by leaps and bounds and the community has great content, too. Not only that, but you get an extra copy of the game with purchase. If you even remotely enjoy puzzle games, especially from a creative standpoint, this is one of the best games on Steam.
Normal

If you like visual puzzles and games with proper physics, well almost, you'll enjoy this. I've got into a habit of doing one or two medium level puzzles a day. It gets me into the right mood for doing other online studies I'm doing. The cartoon, 2D animations work well and there is a good variety. The puzzles are the cascade type where by one action will trigger a chain of other reactions to achieve the final goal. The puzzles start with a few contraptions in place and you have to fill in the gaps from the range of contraptions provided. There is also a sandbox whereby you can build your own cascades and publish them online. Very good value at the sale price.

As good as the old classic just with some upgrades. Spent hours playing this.

The Incredible Machine! Used to play that game back in the 90's and this game brings back memories. Too bad it is way overpriced in my opinion - get it from a sale. The game itself has quite user-friendly learning curve and puzzles get progressively harder. Even though many puzzles have repetitive elements the game is good for casual clicking and the harder levels make you think about applying for physics major or engineering studies (god forbid). I personally don't find (as a physics major, doh) patience to play harder levels for extended periods, but that might be just me. Luckily the levels ain't too bad so you will figure them out sooner or later.  This game (as it's predecessors) has it's value in teaching concept of the cause and the effect. In that sense the game has potential not only to give fun moments for a casual gamer, but to be utilized for teaching children common sense and predicting how systems work. There's a tip for you Steam-parents! Oh, and drop a copy for your the most bestest parent-friends so their younlings can argue about the best ways to turn on the toaster.  Tl;dr: Great old puzzle game from the past with hours fun (and agony) figuring out everyday problems. Great for kids! Wait for sale to buy it as it is now way too expensive.
A perfect successor to the original Incredible Machines.

As a life long fan of The Incredible Machine I was excited at the prospect of the original team coming back, even going as far as buying two copies when the early access first became available.   I have come to regret this choice after speaking with the developers and receiving a rather rude response in regards to the lack of a 32-bit Linux build. Long story short if you dont run a 64-bit build of Linux, 64 still being the minority in the Linux world due to it not being as necessary, nothing will be downloaded and the game will in turn not launch. They have no plans to fix this so if you have been screwed over get your steam refund while you still can. There have also been a number of launch issues on other platforms in which the team has no longer proactive in fixing.  Beyond this there are still a number of TIM gadgets from the newer games that are missing.  My best advice is track down a copy of TIM: Even More Contraptions instead, the team seams to have really bitten off more than they could chew with Contraption Maker.

I happily give this game a qualified thumbs up.  At first, I found the game extremely pleasant; the graphics are bright and cheery and the music is wonderful. Figuring out how the various doodads work was initially pretty stimulating. But after the first hour or two, the initial charm had worn off and the puzzles weren't as satisfying as I would have liked. Then I tried the sandbox; for whatever reason, as an adult (and a programmer) I found this initially pleasing but not very satistfying.  But the kids! I have a 4-year-old and a 6-year-old. They don't play a lot of computer/video games, but they LOVE this one, and I LOVE letting them play it. I really enjoy watching them play and talking with them about the choices they make.

A fun game to mess around in. The puzzles that come with the game are also pretty fun to go through, but personally messing around and making your own is the fun part to me. And hey, it's $7 for 2 copies of the game so you can give a gift of it to a friend.

I had The Incredible Machine: Even More contraptions and I absoloutly loved it, and when I found out the same developers had made a new Rube Goldberg-esque game I couldn't wait to play it. However I was sadly upset to see that the two games are almost identical despite being 12 years apart! There are hardly any new features, what appears to be less levels and less heart and soul put into the game which is apparent in the graphics and content.  I understand I haven't played all the way through it, this is just my initial feeling. And I won't tell you to not buy the game as it will provide quite a while of entertainment, i'm just disappointed that the game isn't what I was hoping it to be,

This is unlike every other puzzle game I've played; for those, there is one, and only one, way to solve the puzzle. I got it on the latest summer sale, but the regular price is reasonable if you aren't patient.
